t1kp.t1m1: Tumeng is a new illustration posting service provided by Beijing Lanwan Boyue Technology Co., Ltd., the company that runs the novel service "Bikan" in mainland China, which has more than 10 million users per month.<0></0>By linking your pixiv to Tumeng, you will be able to share your work with Tumeng users. Don’t you want to try and broaden the reach of your work to new horizons?
t1kp.t1m2:
Tumeng is an illustration posting service managed by Beijing Lanwan Boyue Technology Co., Ltd (location: Beijing, China). Beijing Lanwan Boyue Technology Co., Ltd. manages a popular novel service in China, known as Bikan, with over 10 million users each month. They deliver a large number of works to their users daily.

When you link with Tumeng, your pixiv posts can then be delivered to users on Tumeng. Overcome borders to deliver your works to many fans worldwide!
t1kp.t1m3: You can opt whether or not to link your account to Tumeng. Once you link them, you can decide whether or not to publish each of your illustrations on Tumeng.
t1kp.t1m6: Your Tumeng account, along with all the works and the following, will be completely deleted from Tumeng and no longer available:
t1kp.t1m7:
<0>All data such as the number of followers on your Tumeng account.</0>
<1>All data such as the number of likes, bookmarks and comments on your posts.</1>
t1kp.t1m8: Since all of your Tumeng data will be deleted, it will not be possible to restart your old account in the future. (Your pixiv account and works will not be deleted)
t1kp.t1m9:
The only information to be deleted will be the data shared with Tumeng. Rest assured that your pixiv account, your works, likes and comments will all stay as they are on pixiv.

*<0>Ceasing account-linking service with Tumeng</0>, we will cease allowing new linked accounts with Tumeng on Augut, 29th, 2022. After that, accounts which have had their link with Tumeng deleted will not be able to be relinked.

t1kp.t1n9:
To those who use Tumeng linkage

Profiles for linked accounts will now undergo a review process
t1kp.t1na:
In order to make the Tumeng linkage safer and more secure for everyone to publish their works, a review of the linked Tumeng profiles will start, in addition to the works' review process.

The review will be based on the following three items: nickname, profile image, and self-introduction text. The review status can be checked from your Manage Tumeng linkage page. If your profile does not pass review, please update the relevant information and it will be reviewed again. Once it passes review, you will be able to publish works to Tumeng.

In addition, you can now set up a Tumeng-specific profile.
* If you set up a new Tumeng-specific profile, or if you update your pixiv profile that is being published on Tumen, they will need to undergo review.
* In order to ensure the delivery of your works is in compliance with any changes to local laws and customs, occasional reviews will be conducted in a patrol-like fashion. Please note that the review criteria may change and reviewed accounts may be re-reviewed.

* If you have any questions or concerns, please contact us from the <0>"External Service Linkage" section of the pixiv Contact Us page</0>.
* Please also check <1>this help page</1> for the status of the review process.
t1kp.t1nb: If you have already linked your pixiv profile with Tumeng (managed by: Beijing Lanwan Boyue Technology Co., Ltd., original name: 北京蓝湾博阅科技有限公司, Location: Beijing, China), a portion of the information on your pixiv profile and linked works has been shared with Tumeng, just as stated at the time. If you set a new Tumeng-specific profile, that new information will also be shared. Please note that if you do not set a Tumeng-specific profile now, you won't need to share any new information. Please check <0>this article</0> for more information on information being shared with Tumeng.
t1kp.t1ne:
To everybody using account linking with Tumeng

Account linking with Tumeng is coming to an end.
t1kp.t1nf:
It has been decided that Tumeng’s service will be coming to an end, therefore, we too will be removing the Tumeng account-linking feature as of September 12th, 2022.

Accounts linked with Tumeng will have their linked status removed on September 12th, 2022.
All information that has been shared with Tumeng will be deleted from Tumeng when your link status is removed.

* It may take up to a few days to finish deleting all shared data with Tumeng.

* The only information to be deleted will be the data shared with Tumeng. Rest assured that your pixiv account, your works, likes and comments will all stay as they are on pixiv.

Ahead of the removal of account linking with Tumeng, we will cease allowing new linked accounts with Tumeng on August 29th, 2022, therefore, please understand that if accounts are unlinked from Tumeng after August 29th 2022, they cannot be relinked.

Please consult <1>the main announcement</1> for additional information. Additionally, if anything is unclear, <0>please contact us with “About External Service Linkage” in the subject line</0>.

Thank you for your patronage with Tumeng.

t249.t24a: What is the purpose of qualified invoice issuer (QII) data settings?
t249.t24d: This allows entities who fall under the requirements of the changes in the new Japanese consumption tax (JCT) qualified invoicing system (QIS), effective from October 1st, 2023, to download qualifying invoices for payment and fees for pixiv Requests.
t249.t24b: * This information will not be disclosed to any third parties.
t249.t24c: * Invoices generated by pixiv Requests are created based on information from the <0>Qualified Invoice Issuer Public Disclosure System's web API</0>, but the content is not guaranteed by the National Tax Agency.

t24e.t24d: To set invoicing information, you need a qualified invoice issuer (QII) number. A QII number is a 13-digit number beginning with the letter T that is assigned to entities that have applied to the tax office to receive one.

t24f.t24d: If a fan (requester) who is a QII entity asks for an invoice, the pixiv Inc. Requests team will issue an invoice on behalf (intermediary exemption) of the creator using the name "pixiv Inc." (ピクシブ株式会社).
t24f.t24g: By completing the settings above and meeting the other necessary conditions, on the 28th of each month, you will be able to download an invoice for all your transactions in the previous month. Check the Help section to learn more.

t24i.t24j: To create request terms, you must agree to the pixiv Requests Terms of Use and read the pixiv Requests Guide.

t24n.t1rd: This guide explains important factors creators need to know about when accepting requests from fans, as well as the basic flow of the request process. <0></0>To ensure a fun and comfortable creative process for everyone, please read the following guide before you start accepting requests.

t24p.ta: The four steps <0></0>from request to completion

t24q.ta: Set your terms and start accepting requests
t24q.t1rd: Consider the types of requests you would enjoy working on when you set your request terms.

t24r.t1rd: Requests expire after seven days. There is no penalty for expired requests.

t24s.ta: Complete the request by the deadline
t24s.t1rd: The deadline for all requests is 60 days from the date that the request was received.

t24t.ta: Post the work on pixiv, and you're done!
t24t.t1rd: The billing period ends on the last day of the month in which the request was completed, and the payout is transferred within five business days from the 20th of the following month.

t24u.t1rd: Please check your schedule against the workflow from setting request terms through to receiving your payout.

t24x.ta: Do not respond to individual messages
t24x.t1rd: Privately making arrangements or asking for retakes regarding requests is prohibited. <0></0>If you are contacted about the content of a request via pixiv Messages or via comments, you do not need to respond.

t24y.ta: The creator retains the copyright for the requested work
t24y.t1rd: The creator retains all rights to requested works. <0></0>Fans are only allowed to use the work for personal purposes. (Fans must credit the creator when posting the work on social media, etc.)

t24z.ta: Abide by the Terms of Use
t24z.t1rd: pixiv Requests prioritizes the safety and comfort of all users above all else. <0></0>Please abide by the pixiv <1>Guidelines</1> and <2>Requests Terms of Use</2> when posting requested work, request terms, and cover images.

t251.t253: The lower limit for request pricing is <0>3,000 JPY</0> (approx. 23 USD), while the upper limit is <1>30,000 JPY - 300,000 JPY</1> (approx. 222-2225 USD)
t251.t254: The upper limit fluctuates based on the usage status of the Requests feature. In order to prevent fraud, to set a price of 30,000 JPY or higher, you need to have completed a request and accepted the payout.

t255.t252: How many sets of terms can I create?

t256.t252: What kinds of work can I accept requests for?
t256.t254: For each set of terms, you can choose the type of work you accept requests for.

t257.t254: As of May 29th, 2023, pixiv Requests does not allow AI-generated work.

t258.t254: The deadline for all requests is 60 days from the day you received the request, and not from the day a request is accepted.

t259.t254: If a request is set to Private, it will only be viewable by the creator and the fan who sent it, and no third party will have access to any information. You can change the privacy settings of a request freely at any time after accepting the request.

t25a.t254: When a fan sends a request, they can choose whether to send it along with their username or anonymously, so please note that you may receive anonymous requests.

t25c.t254: Direct communication between fans and creators about requests is prohibited, including consultations and retakes.

t1sh.t1rd: For public requests that are currently in progress, fans who are interested in the content of the request can pay an additional fee (the same price as the original request), in order to support the request.

t25f.t1rd: Creators can attach files in addition to the requested work. Gift files are only accessible to the fan who requested the work, plus any fans who co-requested it.

t25g.t1rd: This feature allows the fans who requested/co-requested to work to express their appreciation to the creator after the request has been completed. Fans can express their impressions of the work, to tell the creator what they like about it.

t24n.t25k: pixiv's Requests feature allows you to solicit requests from fans who want to support your creative work.
t24n.t25l: This feature was created to let fans convey their passions to creators, in the hope that those passions can serve as fuel for creators to dedicate themselves to creative activities.
t24n.t25m: The following guide will help you enjoy the creative process in a safe and pleasurable way. Please take a look at it.

t25o.t25k: The most important thing about the Requests feature is that creators and fans can enjoy the creative process in a safe and pleasurable way.
t25o.t25l: Creators should only accept the requests that they would like to take on.
t25o.t25m: Creators should only accept requests for prices that make them worth it.
t25o.t25p: Fans should convey their ideas and the support for the work of creators in the text containing the details of the request.
t25o.t25q: The Requests feature aims to be a place for creators and fans to enjoy creative activities, not a place to ask for work.

t25r.t25k: All rights to the finished work belong to the creator.
t25r.t25l: Fans who request or co-request a work have only private use privileges. They can do things like admire it privately or make it their SNS profile picture.
t25r.t25m: We ask that fans who want to use the image publicly, like as their profile pic, to please indicate this in the content of their request at the time of submission.

t25u.tfh: pixiv's new Requests feature allows you toset a target price and take on requests from your fans
t25u.t25k: Your motivation to create comes first! You don't have to take on every request you receive. Only accept those you really want to work on.
t25u.t25l: All types of work can be requested: illustrations, manga, novels, and Ugoira. Creators can turn requests on or off for each type of work.
t25u.t25m: When a fan sends a request, they can choose whether to send it along with their username or anonymously, so please note that you may receive anonymous requests.
t25u.t25p: It is possible for creators to set a target price for their requests. We recommend you set an amount that will inspire you to do the request. It is also possible to accept requests that differ from your target price.
t25u.t25q: You do not have to accept every request you receive. Sent requests will be canceled after 7 days. It is also possible to decline requests individually. There is no penalty for refusing requests.
t25u.t25v: The works you complete are displayed on your pixiv profile page just like your other work. Requested work cannot be deleted until 7 days have passed from when the request was completed.
t25u.t25w: It is possible to make a requested work only available to those who requested or co-requested it by making it a URL-restricted work. Please use URL restriction when you want only fans who requested or co-requested the work to be able to view it.
t25u.t25x: The time limit for all requests is 60 days from the day you received the request, and not from the day a request is accepted.
t25u.t25y: If you cannot complete the request in that time frame, then it will be canceled and you won't receive the payment for it. We recommend accepting requests only after you consider your schedule.
t25u.t25z: If you're no longer able to keep up with your creative pace by accepting requests, you can stop accepting them at any time. You can suspend requests on the Request terms page.

t260.tfh: You can use it to tell your fans what kind of requests you want to make.
t260.t25k: Use your Requests terms to communicate with your fans about what kind of requests you would like to make.
t260.t25l: There are times when fans worry about what kind of requests they should send. Please communicate who you are by writing what sort of things you'd like to try and make in your terms' details.
t260.t25m: Fans may also find it easier to send you requests if you set an estimated price or the kinds of work you create.
t260.t25p: You can decorate your terms with a cover image. Setting a cover image can excite fans that go to look at your terms. You can also convey important things you want your fans to know through terms details, without using a cover image.
t260.t25q: You can make up to four different sets of terms. Create your terms based on a particular theme or type of work. Try to enjoy communicating with your fans.
t260.t25v: Please ensure that your terms' details and cover image are in accordance with pixiv's <0>Guidelines</0> and <1>the Requests feature individual Terms of Use</1>.
t260.t25w: If you plan on creating AI-generated work in response to a request, please let your fans know in advance using your sets of terms. Furthermore, you can only post AI-generated works in response to requests sent via sets of terms set to "Post only AI-generated work". (This setting will available as of December 22nd, 2022 JST. It is currently in preliminary rollout phase. See <0>here</0> for details.)
t260.t261: If you plan on creating AI-generated work in response to a request, please let your fans know in advance using your sets of terms. Furthermore, you can only post AI-generated works in response to requests sent via sets of terms set to "Post only AI-generated work".

t262.tfh: Do not reply to personal messages.
t262.t25k: It's prohibited to make arrangements or ask for retakes for requests privately. If you are contacted about the content of a request via pixiv Messages or via comments, you do not need to respond.

t1sh.tfh: If a creator sets a request they received as public, fans will be able to co-request it.
t1sh.t25k: Fans that like the content of a request that a creator accepted publicly can co-request it by paying the same amount. Fans who co-request a work will receive the same artwork and gift file as the fan who first sent the request.
t1sh.t25l: Don't feel pressured if fans co-request a work. You can keep working on it as if you were responding to a single request.
t1sh.t25m: You can change the privacy settings of a request even when the request is already in progress. If you make a request private while it is in progress, fans will no longer be able to co-request it, and only the fan who sent the request and those who already co-requested it will become participants in that request.

t25f.tfh: Requests come with a "gift file" feature.
t25f.t25k: Show your fans how much you appreciate them in your own unique way with a gift file.
t25f.t25l: A gift file is a feature that allows you to send fans a different file than the one you completed by request. Gift files can only be received by the fans who requested and co-requested a work. See the Help page for more information on file formats.
t25f.t25m: You are not required to provide a gift file.

t1r1.tfh: Your profits will be credited to you on pixiv once a request is complete.
t1r1.t25k: The profits from a completed request are displayed on the "Money Management" page, depending on the timing. Payment for requests completed before the end of the month will be made within 5 business days from the 20th of the following month.

t25u.tfh: The Requests feature is a pixiv feature that allows you to send requests to creators.
t25u.t25k: Convey your passions through your requests and send them to the creator along with monetary support.
t25u.t25l: You can only send requests to creators who are currently taking on new requests. These creators will have "Accepting requests" displayed on their pixiv profile page.
t25u.t25m: The "Send a Request" button can be found on both the creator's profile page and the work details page. Enter your offer and your request in text format to send your request. You can not add new information after submitting it. Summarize your desires to the creator in your request.
t25u.t25p: After you send a request, wait for the creator to accept it. Within 7 days of sending your request, the creator will decide whether to accept it or not. If the creator accepts your request, they will complete it and post it to pixiv within 60 days. Please note that these day counts begin on the day you send your request to the creator.
t25u.t25q: You will receive notice from pixiv when a sent request is accepted by a creator and when a requested work is completed by it being posted to pixiv. Additionally, you can have notifications sent to the e-mail you have registered with pixiv.

t262.tfh: Direct communication between the creator and fans about a request is prohibited.
t262.t25k: Convey your desires in the text of your request.
t262.t25l: It's prohibited to make arrangements or ask for retakes privately in pixiv Requests. You cannot contact other users about the content of a request via pixiv Messages, comments, on social media.

t265.tfh: All types of work can be requested: illustrations, manga, novels, and Ugoira.
t265.t25k: Creators can turn requests on or off for each type of work: illustrations, manga, novels, and Ugoira. Please send your request upon checking what requests each creator is currently accepting.
t265.t25l: In the content of your request, please describe the work you are requesting in a way that is easy for the creator to visualize.
t265.t25m: Requests must be made in accordance with pixiv's <0>Guidelines</0> and <1>Requests Terms of Use</1>.
t265.t25p: You may not make requests that do not involve the creation of works, or request videos, photos, music, or anything else in a format that is not supported on pixiv.

t266.tfh: Payment will be required to send your request. If the work you requested is not completed by the deadline, you will be refunded.
t266.t25k: Send your requests while keeping the creator's target price in mind. You can send amounts higher or lower than their listed target price.
t266.t25l: If the creator declines the request you sent, or if it is not accepted within 7 days, the request will be canceled.
t266.t25m: There is no penalty for declined requests. The money you paid will be refunded to you. You will also receive a refund if the creator's work is not completed within 60 days since receiving your request.
t266.t25p: If you are using a debit card, you will be charged when submitting your request. Please see the <0>Help page</0> for more information.

t267.tfh: Once your request is approved, just wait until it's finished.
t267.t25k: When a request is public, it can be shared on social media, which may attract even more people to share it and co-request it. Let's support the work of the creator together with others.

t1sh.t25k: Fans can co-request a request that the creator accepted publicly it by paying the same amount. If you like the content of the request and you would like to see the finished work too, you can choose to send a co-request.
t1sh.t25l: Fans who co-request a work will receive the same artwork and gift file as the fan who first sent the request.

t268.tfh: You can send requests and co-requests anonymously.
t268.t25k: When you send a request, you can choose whether to send it along with your username or anonymously. The same goes for co-requests.
t268.t25l: If you don't want people to know you have sent a request, if you want to support a creator secretly or if you don't want your name to appear next to a request, consider sending your request anonymously.

t269.tfh: Contents and prices of in-progress requests may disclosed publicly.
t269.t25k: The privacy settings for a request are set by the creator when they receive the request.
t269.t25l: The privacy settings of a request can be changed even when the request is already in progress. If the creator makes a request private while it is in progress, fans will no longer be able to co-request it, and only the fan who sent the request and those who already co-requested it will become participants in that request.

t25f.tfh: Requests come with a "gift file" feature.
t25f.t25k: A gift file is a feature that allows you to send fans a different file than the one you completed by request. Gift files can only be received by the fans who requested and co-requested a work.
t25f.t25l: The creator is not required to provide a gift file. The availability of gift files depends on the request.

t297.t1qz: How can I send a request?
t297.t1r0: Here are some useful hints for sending requests.

t298.ta: If you're unsure about how to write a request...
t298.tb:
If you're not sure about what to write, you can use a template.
If you're interested in a creator who has accepted requests in the past, you can also view the requests others have sent by visiting the Requests tab on their profile page.

You can also piggyback on someone else's request (aka "co-request") by adding the same amount to an existing request. For more details on the co-request feature, please check the Help page.

t299.ta: If you're unsure about how much to pay...
t299.tb:
Base your decision on the target price set by the creator.
The time and effort required to create a piece can vary depending on the number of characters, the detail of the background, the length in case of a novel, and so on.
When in doubt, offering the target price is your safest bet.

t29a.ta: If you want to send a request anonymously...
t29a.tb:
When entering your request, you can choose to send it anonymously.
If you do so, your account information will not be visible to the creator or anyone else.

t29b.tb:
pixiv Requests does not allow any direct interactions with the creators, including discussions or revisions.
Please refrain from using direct messages or the comments section to discuss request details or set deadlines. Make sure to include all your requirements and expectations directly in the request text itself.

t297.t28g: Check the Help section to learn more

t28z.tb: In your terms, you can set the conditions for what kind of requests you would like to receive, such as the type of work and the target price. Once you publish your terms, they'll be open for requests.

t290.tb: Review the details and rewards of the requests you receive, and accept only the ones you feel comfortable with. You should decide whether to accept a request within 7 days of receiving it.

t291.ta: Create your work and post it to pixiv
t291.tb: You have 60 days from the date you receive a request to complete and submit the work. Simply finish the piece within this timeframe and upload it to pixiv to complete the process!

t292.t1qz: Are there any rules or special features for soliciting requests?
t292.t1r0: Here are some useful hints for soliciting requests.

t298.tb:
You are not required to accept all requests that come your way on pixiv Requests. What’s most important is that you feel excited about creating!
Additionally, if you miss the deadline, don't worry—there are no penalties.
If accepting new requests becomes overwhelming, you can pause your terms anytime.

t299.tb:
You can set your prices starting from a minimum of 3,000 JPY up to 30,000 JPY, which can go up to 300,000 JPY depending on how you wish to manage your offerings.
We recommend setting a price that feels right for you, and you can vary your terms based on different price points.
*The displayed currency will always be Japanese yen.

t29a.tb:
pixiv Requests does not allow negotiations or revisions through direct messages or comments.
If you receive any messages related to request content on pixiv, there’s no need to respond.

t29b.tb:

t27l.t29c: Co-request together with others! pixiv's new Requests feature was released!

t29d.ta:
What you can do with
pixiv requests
t29d.tb:
pixiv's new Requests feature allows you to
set a target price and take on requests from your fans
t29d.t29e: Creators can publicly accept requests so that it's possible for everyone to co-request them!
t29d.t29f:
Fans that like the content of a request
can co-request it and pay the same amount
which helps support the creator!
t29d.t29g:
Accept as many Requests
as you want to make!
t29d.t29h: Your motivation to create comes first! You don't have to take on every request you receive. Only accept those you really want to work on ー they can be as many as you like!
t29d.t29i:
Jump on other people's bandwagons
using the Co-Request feature!
t29d.t29j: If thinking of a request seems too hard, we have got you covered! pixiv's Requests include a co-request feature. Join another user's request by offering the same amount to the creator and convey your passions to them!
t29d.t29k: If thinking of a request seems too hard, we have prepared a special feature to make things easier!
t29d.t29m: Requests are born from the encounter between passions and the desire to support a creator monetarily! Your unique requests might lead to new works. Enjoy a new way of sharing passions, connecting creators and fans!

t29n.ta:
pixiv Requests lets you
convey your passions!
t29n.t29o: I'd like this creator to use their unique style to draw something like this!
t29n.t29p: With everyone's support, I want to push myself to do something I normally can't.
t29n.t29q: I want to read a sequel to this manga!
t29n.t29r: I want a continuation of this series made!
t29n.t29s: I want to please even more fans!
t29n.t29t: I want to see my OCs in the style of the creator I love!
t29n.t29u: I just want to support them secretly...
t29n.t29v: I want to create work with everyone, not by myself
t29n.t29w: At any rate, I just want some sort of theme!
t29n.t29x: I could use some new ideas!
t29n.t29y: I want to read a story by that artist written in my favorite setting!

t1sh.tb:
Co-requests from other fans can be taken on within pixiv Requests.
This function lets fans enjoy the same reward as the original requester.
Creators may attach gift files limited just to requesting fans at the time of work completion.

t2a0.tb:
With the release of pixiv Requests right around the corner,
we accepted comments from various creators!

t2a2.t2a3: Creating mainly original works. Feel free to request anything.
t2a2.t2a4:
Hi there, I'm Shiratama. I've decided to try this thing out!
I don't usually accept requests from individuals, so I thought this would be a great opportunity to hear directly from everyone about what kind of characters and situations they would like me to draw. I'm looking forward to seeing what kind of requests I get. Thanks!
t2a2.t2a5:
I usually draw whatever comes to my mind, so I'm looking forward to receiving your illustration requests that will hopefully inspire me to draw something that I wouldn't have thought of before!
Thank you!
t2a2.t2a6: I've never accepted individual requests up until now to avoid trouble, but since pixiv has started this new service I think I'll be able to communicate with everyone smoothly!
t2a2.t2a7: This feature! I can't even imagine how much fun I'm gonna have with it! I'm looking forward to finding out with my fans!!
t2a2.t2a8: It's been about 10 years since I started using pixiv, so the fact that a service so familiar to me has started this new feature made me want to try it.
t2a2.t2a9:
As a creator, I am very happy to be able to build a new bridge between the artist and the people who see my work.
I'm looking forward to working with my fans to create something that I couldn't have thought of by myself.
t2a2.t2aa: Differently from regular commissions, this service includes a co-request feature and allows you to disclose the contents of a request, so I would like to use it as a communication tool with the people who always check out my works!
t2a2.t2ab:
This sounds like fun!
I've never used a feature like this before, so I hope I'll have a good time with it.
I'm looking forward to using it in order to challenge myself to draw themes and motifs that I'm not usually good at!
t2a2.t2ac:
I'm looking forward to the Requests feature because it'll give me the chance to draw all sorts of things!
I think the beauty of it is that you can easily request an illustration without having to think of it as a job! I hope requests will make people enjoy illustrations even more.
t2a2.t2ad: As a creator, I am very happy to hear that you can receive requests through pixiv. I'm looking forward to using this feature so that I can create works that will make people who requested them happy!
t2a2.t2ae: Sounds interesting! I'd like to give it a try because it's easy to open your requests and you can decide if you want to take on each challenge at your own pace after looking at the content of each request!
t2a2.t2af: This is the first time I use this kind of feature, but it sounds like a lot of fun and exciting to give a shape to the ideas of people who always check out my manga and illustrations!
t2a2.t2ag: It's a very innovative feature, and I think it will enrich the activities of both creators and fans on pixiv more than ever before. When it comes to manga, there's a wide range of things one can request, from certain genres or situations to more detailed requests like turning movies or novels into a manga. For the creators, it could be an indicator of their own needs and strengths, and an opportunity to try new works!
t2a2.t2ah:
Since pixiv has so many registered users, I think this feature will make it easier to smoothly send and accept requests.
I'm looking forward to starting receiving requests and draw illustrations that I wouldn't have come up with otherwise!
t2a2.t2ai: It will be a lot of fun to have access to such an environment where you can easily ask your favorite artists to draw something for you or join other people's requests. I'd like to contribute to this service both as a creator and a fan.
t2a2.t2aj: As for the Co-request feature, I understand how it can make the creator happy to get paid more, but from a fan's standpoint, I was worried whether the first one to request something would get jealous because they wanted their request to be only theirs. However, the content of the original request doesn't change and I realized that co-requests feel more like a way to join the requester in giving the artist even more support.
t2a2.t2ak: I'm Henreader. I'd like to open many new doors while accepting various commissions (sounds serious) from my great friends. I hope you'll tag along.

t28z.tb: Creators consider what types of requests they'll accept when they decide on their terms

t290.tb:
Fans will briefly summarize the content of the work they want to see from a creator. They send a request using the creator's target price as a base for the amount they'll set.
This is the only contact they'll have with the creator.

t291.tb: Creators should pick requests they really want to accept! Fans that truly value their creators will not expect them to overexert themselves by responding.

t2ao.tb:
Creators start the work.
They can stream the creative process via <0>pixivSketchLIVE</0> and show fans WIP sketches on <1>pixivFANBOX</1>.

If fans like the content of an accepted request and want to support the creator, they can co-request the work.

t2ap.tb:
When the work is done, finish the request by posting it to pixiv. Creators can limit the privacy settings for it at the time of posting.
Once the request is completed, a downloadable gift file can be attached only for fans who paid.

t2aq.ta: How do I send a request?
t2aq.t1r0: The "Send a Request" button can be found on both the creator's profile page and the work details page. You can send a request up to 1000 characters. You can not add new information after submitting. Summarize your desires to the creator in your request.

t2ar.t1r0: It is possible for you to request anonymously. You can choose whether or not to send it anonymously at the time of making the request. It is also possible to co-request anonymously.

t2as.ta: How do I decide on a target price for accepting requests?
t2as.t1r0:
It is possible for creators to set one target price for requests. We recommend you set an amount that will inspire you to do the request.

It is also possible to accept requests that differ from your target price.

t2at.ta: How do I decide the price I send with my request?
t2at.t1r0: Send your requests while keeping the creator's target price in mind. You can send amounts higher or lower than their listed target price.

t2au.ta: Are illustrations the only kind of work that can be requested?
t2au.t1r0: You can use pixiv Requests for illustrations, Ugoira, manga, and novels. Try sending your favorite creators passion-filled requests!

t2av.ta: Can I send requests to anyone?
t2av.t1r0: You can only send requests to creators who are currently taking on new requests. These creators will have "Accepting requests" displayed on their pixiv profile page.

t2aw.ta: Do I have to take on all the requests I receive?
t2aw.t1r0: You do not have to accept every request you receive. Sent requests will be canceled after 7 days. It is also possible to refuse requests individually. There is no penalty for refusing requests.

t2ax.ta: Depending on the number of co-requests, can the content of a request be modified or added to?
t2ax.t1r0: Creators cannot modify or add to the content of a request. Furthermore, there is no need to feel pressure if there are a lot of fans co-requesting. Plan on making the work based on just the one request.

t2ay.ta: Can I contact the fan/creator privately?
t2ay.t1r0:
It's prohibited to make arrangements or ask for retakes privately in pixiv Requests. You cannot contact other users about the content of a request via pixiv Messages or via comments.

Please convey your passions in the request description as best you can.

t2az.ta: What is the time limit for completing a request?
t2az.t1r0:
The time limit for all requests is 60 days from the day of delivery. It is not from the day a request is accepted.
If you cannot complete the request in that time frame, then it will be canceled and you cannot receive the payment for it. We recommend accepting requests only after you consider your schedule.

t2b0.ta: Where do requested works go when completed?
t2b0.tb:
Completed work is displayed on your pixiv profile page just like your other work. Requested work cannot be deleted until 7 days have passed from when the request was completed.
It is possible to make requested work only available to those who requested or co-requested it by making it a URL-restricted work. Please use URL restriction when you want only fans who requested or co-requested the work to be able to view it.

t2b1.tb:
This feature allows you to add an extra file of your choosing to the work upon its completion. It is possible for only the original requester and co-requesting fans to receive a gift file.

It is not necessary to attach a gift file. The gift file can be used how you see fit, whether it be to include sketches, line work, originals, or signed work. Try thinking about how you want your gifts to be unique.

t2b2.ta: Where can I check the status of a request I sent?
t2b2.tb: You will receive notice from pixiv when a sent request is accepted by a creator and when a requested work is completed by it being posted to pixiv. Additionally, you can have notifications sent to your email registered with pixiv.

t2b3.ta: What can I do while waiting for a request to be completed?
t2b3.tb: You can look for people to co-request the work. You might find friends, or even strangers via social media, who like the content and are willing to co-request it.

t2b4.ta: What happens to the rights of requested works?
t2b4.tb:
All rights remain with the creator.

Fans who request or co-request a work have only private use privileges. They can do things like admire it privately or make it their SNS profile picture.

We ask that fans who want to use the image publicly, like as their profile pic, to please indicate this in the content of their request at the time of submission.

t2b5.ta: When can I claim my profits?
t2b5.tb: The profits from a completed request are displayed on the "Money Management" page, depending on the timing. Payment for requests completed before the end of the month will be made within 5 business days from the 20th of the following month.

pixiv is developing even more services!
We plan on adding other linkable services to pixiv Requests in the future!

Users' projects are events held by other members of the pixiv community, to which you can participate posting your work.

Sign up for pixiv Premium <0>here.

ta.ta:
For everyone from digital beginners to pros.
What is the standard in illustration apps, Clip Studio Paint?
ta.t2tz: Clip Studio Paint is the most used* illustration app among pixiv users. With over 30 million users around the world, the number of new fans joining its ranks continues to rise every day.
ta.t2u0: * For six years running, it has been named as the most used app on the world’s largest illustration social network, pixiv (data provided by pixiv from December 2015 -December 2022, compiled by Celsys).
ta.t2u1: As the standard in painting apps, it is packed with all the functions you need to create illustrations and digital art. Enjoy the feeling of a traditional drawing experience with a simple and easy-to-understand user interface, this model is useful for a wide range of users, from those starting out their digital art journey, to seasoned professionals.

t2u4.ta: Possible to use on your two favorite devices, like your smartphone and your tablet, at the same time!
t2u4.t2u5: All the same functions are available on computer platforms like Windows, macOS and Chromebook as are on iPad, iPhone, Android and Galaxy smartphone and tablet devices, for an equally smooth as butter creative experience when you are on the move.

t2u6.ta: Draw intuitively on your smartphone and tablet with a simple UI!
t2u6.t2u7: Simple Mode makes switching tools a breeze and drawing more intuitive on smartphone and tablet devices (iPad/iPhone/Galaxy/Android/Chromebook).*
t2u6.t2u8: The app includes a selection of tools to make digital drawing easy for everyone, even beginners, from basic illustration tools to popular advanced features such as poseable 3D models, liquify, and smart color filling of closed areas.
t2u6.t2u9: *You can use it by updating your Clip Studio Paint Debut for pixiv to the latest version. You can use the dual-device plan to use the smartphone version if you are currently using a one-time purchase license.

t2ua.ta: Features a wealth of brushes to make painting fun!
t2ua.t2u5: Over 40,000 brushes are available for download, from brushes that capture the painting styles of traditional media like watercolor-, oil-, and airbrushes, to brushes that make it easy to paint decorative elements and backgrounds such as flowers, grass, chains, and dotted lines! (<0>Check out full list here</0>) You’re certain to find the perfect brush for your artwork.

t2ub.ta: Draw difficult angles and poses easy with 3D functionality!
t2ub.t2u5: Load 3D drawing figures, characters, accessories, and backgrounds to your canvas for use as references. Adjust poses and body shapes as you like. You can also register frequently drawn body shapes and poses as materials and reuse them anytime!

t2uc.ta: Get some new color inspiration with AI colorization!
t2uc.t2u5: Clip Studio Paint’s AI can color your artwork as if by magic. Use line art and hint images to help the AI automatically colorize your work and maybe even find new inspiration!

t2ud.ta: Access a vast online library of ready-to-use materials and tutorials!
t2ud.t2ue: Download any of the more than 70,000 free materials including pens, brushes, screentones, and 3D materials, both official and user-created, to help you create your artwork. You’re certain to find the perfect material for your artwork.
t2ud.t2ug: Check out our pro tutorials, with art tips and guides on using Clip Studio Paint features from real professional artists. As well as the free Clip Studio TIPS guides and YouTube tutorials, there are also many guidebooks available for sale to help you learn the ropes. No matter if it’s your first time, or you’ve been drawing for years, there are materials to guide you every step of the way.
t2ud.t2uh: Clip Studio TIPS: Digital Art Tutorials

t2uj.ta: Easily share comics and animations you create directly to social media!
t2uj.t2u5: From timelapse videos of your art process to adding animation to your drawings, use the integrated share button for a simple way to share your work to social media and other services.

t2uk.ta: Built with features to streamline your creative process!
t2uk.t2u5: From text input, shape tools, gradients, and filters - all the tools essential for drawing are here all in one package. Clip Studio Paint Debut also offers a full range of import and export functions, such as scanner support, useful if you draw on paper and then switch to digital to clean up your work, and Photoshop file support so your files can be used in other apps.

t2ul.ta: Easy to upgrade to the PRO and EX versions!
t2ul.t2u7: You can easily upgrade to a higher grades PRO or EX from right within the app, with no need for additional downloads, or a different operating system! Broaden your artistic range and quickly create beautiful works of art, just as you imagine them!
t2ul.t2u8: What’s more, users of the Clip Studio Paint Debut for pixiv plan get access to discounted upgrades to the higher PRO and EX grades of the app!*
t2ul.t2u9: * Current Clip Studio Paint Debut Dual-device plan users who signed up via this page are eligible for the discounted pricing for monthly usage plans.
t2ul.t2un: * CLIP STUDIO PAINT supports Japanese, English, French, German, Spanish, Korean, Traditional Chinese, Simplified Chinese, Thai, Indonesian, and Portuguese.
t2ul.t2uo: Currently, the usual method for applying for a discounted upgrade is temporarily unavailable. Please check <0>here</0> for further details on how to apply.

t36y.ta: Keeping this project fun and light-hearted
t36y.t38b:
It's a project where you can show your support for works posted to pixiv through emojis.
Everybody can convey their feelings to creators with not just likes and ❤️, but with all kinds of emojis that show their appreciation.
t36y.t38d: The following guide will help you enjoy the creative process in a safe and fun way. Please take a look at it.
t36y.t38e: Be aware of region-different emoji habits
t36y.t38f: Some emojis have different meanings across different regions. Please look into how an emoji is used so that you don't end up conveying something you didn't intend through your personal understanding of the emoji. The following examples are just an introduction to how emoji use differs based on region.
t36y.t38g: Additionally, you can also choose not to display emojis if unsuitable emojis are attached to your work.
t36y.t38i: Examples of emojis used differently depending on the region
t36y.t38k: Difference in meaning based on region
t36y.t38l: There are regions where gesture and hand sign emojis are used to insult others.
t36y.t38m: There are regions where this emoji is used to express the negative meaning of criticism or controversy, but there are also regions where it is used to express the positive meaning of "hot" as in "good looking".
t36y.t38n: There are regions where this emoji is used to mean "I'm so sad I'm bawling", but there are also regions where it is used with the inverse meaning of "I can't laugh about it, but it was entertaining".
t36y.t38o: There are regions where this emoji is used to beckon people, but there are also regions where this emoji is just used sarcastically.
t36y.t38p: There are regions where these emojis are used in a sexual context and thus censored on some services.
t36y.t38q:
*It is possible that unexpected communication will occur because of differences in regional emoji habits.
・Please consider that you might inadvertently cause harm to the creator even if you intend to express a positive feeling when you attach an emoji to a work.
・Please consider that the emoji attached to your work was not done maliciously when an unsuitable emoji is attached to one of your works.
t36y.t38r: Prohibited conduct and emojis that cannot be attached to works
t36y.t38s: You cannot attach emojis that are intended to abuse or fall under the following to any work posted on pixiv.
t36y.t38u: ・Making unauthorized reproductions such as using screenshots from games or anime, or the creations of other illustrators
t36y.t38v: ・Any conduct that falls under <0>Terms of Use, Section 14: Prohibited Conduct</0>
t36y.t38w: ・Any conduct deemed to be opposed to the goals of this project by the management team
t36y.t38x: Emojis that cannot be attached to a work
t36y.t38y: ・Emojis that would fall under <0>R-18 or R-18G</0>.
t36y.t38z:
・Emojis that can be determined to be real pictures.
・Emojis that are slanderous, threatening, economically damaging, or emotionally damaging.
・Emojis that have been created with the goal of advertising.
・Emojis that express sexual content in a distorted state.
・Emojis that express support for counter-cultural conduct.
・Emojis that express discrimination based on somebody's ethnicity, gender, belief, occupation, or religion.
・Emojis that promote extreme political or cult religious activities.
・Emojis that include personal information.
t36y.t1qx: Q&A concerning how the management team will handle emojis
t36y.t390: To everyone attaching emojis to works
t36y.t391: What will happen if a guidelines-violating emoji is created and attached to a work?
t36y.t392: The management team will deal with it privately. Additionally, we may suspend accounts due to malicious behavior.
t36y.t393: Will we no longer be able to attach created emojis to posts after the project period?
t36y.t394: You will no longer be able to attach created emojis to posts or browse them after the project period.
t36y.t395: Can I use emojis created by other people?
t36y.t396: You can attach to posts either emojis you created yourself or emojis created by others.
t36y.t397: I think an emoji that violates the guidelines was attached to a post.
t36y.t398: Please report the emoji through the <0>"Report a problem" button on the emoji view</0>. Our management team will confirm if it violates the guidelines and take necessary action.
t36y.t39a: I think an emoji that violates the guidelines was attached to my post.
t36y.t39b: Please report the emoji through the <0>"Report a problem" button on the emoji view</0>. Our management team will confirm if it violates the guidelines and take necessary action.
t36y.t39c: Can I individually remove emojis that are attached to my own posts?
t36y.t39d: You can remove an emoji attached to your own posts <0>by clicking "Remove emoji" from the emoji view.</0>
t36y.t39e: I don't want emojis attached to my work.
t36y.t39f: You can change your settings so that no emojis will be allowed on all of your works by <0>clicking the  "Turn emojis OFF" button on the emoji settings page.</0> *You cannot turn off emojis on a work-by-work basis.
t36y.t39g: Please reference the <0>help page</0> for anything else you're unclear about.
t36y.t39h: We ask for everybody's support and understanding so that we can create a fun event where everybody can focus on communicating their warm feelings.

t3ck.t3d4: By posting a work based on the theme "Light", you can earn more points for Team Light.
t3ck.t3d5: By posting a work based on the theme "Dark", you can earn more points for Team Dark.
t3ck.t3da: 1. Confirm that you'd like to enter
t3ck.t3db: carefully, and refine your entry concept accordingly.
t3ck.t3dc: 2. Choose which team you'd like to join, and create a work to match that team
t3ck.t3df: Original work and fan art are both okay.
t3ck.t3dg: There is no restriction on the size of the artwork you can submit.
t3ck.t3dh: Only All Ages works will be accepted.
t3ck.t3di: You can submit more than one work. However, you cannot submit the same work multiple times.
t3ck.t3dk: There are no format restrictions (short story, long story, series, etc.) on the novels you can submit.
t3ck.t3dl: Original work and fan fiction are both okay.
t3ck.t3dm: Even if you add the entry tag to a series, the works within that series will not be considered submissions. To enter, make sure you tag each specific work.
t3ck.t3dn: Only All Ages works will be accepted.
t3ck.t3dq: You can give points to your team by posting works or adding bookmarks.
t3ck.t3ds: Each work posted during the contest period will give 30 points to that work's affiliated team.
t3ck.t3du: For each bookmark added to works submitted to this contest, one point will be awarded to the work's affiliated team.
t3ck.t3dv: Total points will be calculated once per day, and the running totals will be posted daily on the contest page by 1:00 pm JST.
t3ck.t3dw: Only works that were posted within the time frame of the contest are eligible for adding points. If the work was posted during the time frame of the contest, but the contest tag was added at a later date, the work will still contribute contest points.
t3ck.t3dx: Each user may post up to one work per day to contribute points. No points from posts or bookmarks will be added to the second or subsequent works posted in a single day by a single user.
t3ck.t3dy: If you add the tags for both teams to your work, points will be added to both teams.
t3ck.t3dz: 3. Post your work with the contest tag for the team you're supporting.
t3ck.t3cq: Before posting, double-check to make sure your work fits the entry format and contest terms.
t3ck.t3e1: Sit tight and wait until the results are announced!
t3ck.t3e3:
This contest is a team-based competition where you can post illustrations, manga, ugoira, and novels to support either Team Light or Team Dark and help your favorite team win!
You can give points to your preferred team by posting works or adding bookmarks.
t3ck.t3e4: Create a work that aligns with the contest in both theme and format and post it with the appropriate tags to pixiv within the submission period.
t3ck.t3e6: This contest is open to all registered pixiv users who have read and agreed to these Application Guidelines.
t3ck.t3e7: * Entries from companies and multiple creators will not be accepted.
t3ck.t3e8: * Underage contestants should obtain consent from a guardian before entering.
t3ck.t3ea: Points will be awarded to teams under the following circumstances. The team who racks up the most points by the end of the contest wins victory!
t3ck.t3eb: From Monday, May 15th to Thursday, June 29th, 2023 at 11:59 am JST
t3ck.t3ee: * Works that fall under the following categories are not eligible. Thank you for your understanding.
t3ck.t3ef: Works that do not fit the theme of the contest
t3ck.t3eg: Works with the privacy level set to “My pixiv” or “Private”
t3ck.t3eh: Works that are reposts of previous work or are not submitted within the time frame of the contest
t3ck.t3ei: Works that are ineligible under the Contest Terms
t3ck.t3ej: Your submission will serve as an acceptance of the terms outlined throughout this entire document. Please be sure you have read them before submitting your entry.
t3ck.t3ek: (1) If your entry, including your nickname, falls into the statements below, it will be considered invalid.
t3ck.t3el: Additionally, pixiv reserves the right to disqualify a work if the work is determined to violate the rules even after being selected as a winner.
t3ck.t3em: Works that violate the ownership rights of pixiv Inc, pixiv users, and other third parties; as well as intellectual property rights, including copyright, privilege, trust, and other privacy rights.
t3ck.t3en: Works that contain obscenity, torture, discrimination, explicit sexual themes, and/or other elements that are potentially offensive.
t3ck.t3eo: Works that violate public order and morals.
t3ck.t3ep: Works that are unsuitable for public display as determined by pixiv Inc.
t3ck.t3eq: Any works based on existing work/goods, works/goods scheduled to be released, works/goods that have already been submitted for other contests, or works/goods that have already won other contests (with the exemption of * 1).
t3ck.t3er: Works that pixiv Inc. finds inappropriate may also be disqualified.
t3ck.t3es: (2) Contestants own all rights to their artwork/creations.
t3ck.t3et: (3) Contestants will not be informed when the selection results are announced. There will be no public announcement of the winners. Only winners will be informed by the official account of pixiv and/or pixiv related services. If winners do not respond within a certain period of time after being contacted, they may not be able to receive their prize(s).
t3ck.t3eu: (4) Contestants, regardless if they win or not, may have their entries, pixiv nicknames, and other related items to the contest, posted to pixiv’s official Twitter, Facebook, and other social network accounts, displayed at exhibitions, and/or printed in magazines or books. pixiv may adapt or minorly edit the work for reprinting.
t3ck.t3ev: (4) Contestants, regardless if they win or not, may have their entries, pixiv nicknames, and other related items to the contest, posted to pixiv’s official X account, Facebook, and other social network accounts, displayed at exhibitions, and/or printed in magazines or books. pixiv may adapt or minorly edit the work for reprinting.
t3ck.t3ew: (5) Contestants who remove their entries during the contest will forfeit the contest, and their work will no longer be accepted as an entry.
t3ck.t3ex: (6) pixiv Inc. will not be responsible for any charges contestants may incur during the submission of their entry.
t3ck.t3ey: (7) pixiv Inc. will use the contestant's information solely for the purpose of communicating with the contestants about the contest and during the selection process. pixiv Inc. will protect individual contestants' information according to pixiv's privacy policy.
t3ck.t3ez: * 1 Posting the same work on pixiv Sketch will not get you disqualified.
t3ck.t3f0: (8) Prizes will be awarded by lottery, with each account counting as one entry, regardless of the number of works posted. Posting multiple works will not increase your chances of winning.
t3ck.t3f2: (1) Contestants assume responsibility for their own submissions.
t3ck.t3f3: (2) pixiv Inc. will not bear responsibility for any disputes that may happen between the contestants and other users, or between the contestants and third parties, regardless of the reason.
t3ck.t3f4: (3) pixiv Inc. reserves the right to suspend or terminate the contest without advance notice in case pixiv Inc. deems it necessary for any reason, including system maintenance.
t3ck.t3f5: (4) pixiv Inc. will not be liable for any damages incurred by the contestants, including but not limited to contest interruption, suspension, or cancellation.
t3ck.t3f6: (5) Determined by the true terms and conditions including the disclaimers, pixiv Inc. will be not responsible for any direct damages caused by willful misconduct or gross negligence caused during the contest period, regardless of immunity.
t3ck.t3f8: (1) If you have any questions or feedback about the contest, feel free to contact us <0>here</0>.
t3ck.t3f9: (2) Please include your email address, nickname, inquiry, and the subject “About pixivVS" before submitting your support request.
t3ck.t3fa: (3) Replies will not be given to any phone calls regarding support issues.
